intro: Hieracium furcatum subsp. megalanthes, commonly known as the giant hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces achene seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
